title: Why can't Sunfire Cape be a toggle?
body:
Think about it - right now, buying a Sunfire Cape (or even Bami's Cinder) in lane is both a blessing and a curse - the AOE is nice, the armor and health are great, it's cost efficient, but it auto-pushes your lane, you can't make intelligent plays to punish your enemy laner at tower (at least if you're melee), and it can sometimes be really hard to last hit.

Enter the toggle effect; you still keep the armor and health, but you can turn off the damage aura to stop pushing your lane, so you can pull off some sick tower dives without worrying about the aura giving you unwanted turret aggro, and you can farm without having to worry about any more unwanted numbers entering the last hit equation. 

It would even help for other random things.  Trying to escape a bad team fight or run from a gank?  Need to run through the jungle? Oh, you flashed into baron pit and it aggro'd and shat all over you because of your Sunfire aura? Not anymore.

...Anyway, those are my thoughts.  Anyone else agree/disagree?

> [{quoted}](name=Mmm Broccoli,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WaUiZMzr,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-04-12T20:45:01.818+0000)
> 
> What I'm saying is when you turn off the aura, you're turning off the damage.  The only reason people get Sunfire Cape as opposed to Randuin's Omen is the aura - it's the upside.  When you toggle it off, you're reversing the upsides and downsides.  You turn off the aura, which takes away the damage and the identity of the item but opens up windows of opportunity for other types of play.

Another idea I've had in regards to Cinderhulk... have Sunfire Cape have a toggle, but every time you turn it on and off, it has to ramp the damage up to its full potential, similar to Cinderhulk, but still retaining the toggle ability.  This way, someone can't just turn it off, dive you, and turn it back on for full, unavoidable damage.  It would have to take a few seconds for either the damage to take effect or for the damage to become something of a threat instead of negligible.

TL;DR - The person who's using Sunfire Cape should be able to choose whether or not they want all the downsides that come with the upsides of the aura, not be forced to play around them.

replies.body: The first toggle item to ever be in this game. Sweet
{{item:3042}} is a toggle item
Yeah, that's what i need in a heated battle, accidentally turning off free damage.

If you just smash your keyboard in every fight, it will be a problem.

If you actually know what are you doing, it will not. In the worst case, you can turn it on again.
Sunfire Cape Katarina confirmed.

Nah, for two reasons:

1. It has a downside to it. We should keep that to ensure smart playing.
2. Just like zhonyas and every support item active ever, we're likely to forget to toggle it *back.*

Why is it having a downside a reason to ensure smart playing. No other item in the game has any downsides at all, only benefits to you. Not to mention your reason number two is your fault and yours only for forgetting to toggle it back. So just because people forget to use their Zhonya's active we should now remove the active?

Now you're making leaps of logic. I could have made this more clear, but toggled items add a layer of complexity when we already have spells and item actives to manage. 

Please don't put words in my mouth, I would never suggest removing item actives.

And the downsides give counterplay (tracking people with sunfire's isn't too hard in the jungle if you look for camps that are resetting), plus if someone is pushing your tower you can get tower aggro on them just by walking near them and taking a little bit of damage (like Irelia hitting Q on Shen, making her tower target him since she got touched by the passive).

Thing is, no other item in the game has a downside like the Sunfire Cape does. No item should just make you take free damage just by walking around in the jungle. No item should force you to take turret aggro despite you doing nothing at all but attacking the turret. Doesn't really make sense to me having all these downsides.

Because it makes split-pushing and farming easier for tanks, and speeds up jungle clears for bruisers who don't take cinderhulk. Also increases dps in melee range combat. It has plenty of upsides to it.

It might make split-pushing easier, but it does not make farming easier. It makes it harder to CS, not to mention the fact that it auto pushes your wave, all without you doing anything at all. You are acting like he is proposing we completely take away the passive. He is proposing that we allow to _toggle_ it, so you will _still_ get the benefits, all without the annoyance of random aggro and unwanted pushing. What's wrong with that?

*shrugs*

If anything, Riot should test it. See if the added complexity either removes or adds strategic diversity and counterplay, or is more of a nuisance than a useful tool. Typically items have passives or actives, so this might be a slight shift for itemization in the future if this was made. 

If it turns out to be a great thing, then great let's do it. I'm just hesitant and not sure, so I decided to voice my opinion on why I think it's not a good idea. If I turn out to be wrong, it's not the end of the world. Keep advocating it if you want, and see about getting Riot to look into it.

Edit: Sight, I literally said Riot should test it, and just voiced some concerns. I have an opinion, I'm not on the balancing team or anyone important.
I would love for a Red to come in here and give their thoughts/opinions/insights on the subject.  I'm sure this idea has been discussed before, Riot isn't dumb, so I'd love to hear their side of it.
Dude your only getting people to dislike your comments. Toggled Sunfire Cape is great because LoL is not all about gold and killing minions waves.

Well sorry for not having a popular opinion...?

If I changed my opinions to get upvotes or be part of the majority just for the sake of it, even if my own thoughts came to an opposite conclusion, do you really that would be a respectable opinion? And I even listened to others, instead of saying "You're wrong completely and I'm 100% right!" and even told people to keep advocating for Riot to check it out to see if it's a good thing.

Have you considered maybe you're wrong? What if by some chance I'm right? There's no way to know 100% for sure unless there was actual testing, so it'd be nice if people could share different opinions instead of receiving "You're objectively wrong, my opinion is right because..." without any data and only speculation and theory.

So please, respect my opinion even if you don't agree with it. It's not like I shut out all discussion and never listened to anybody's points, so I'd like the same level of respect.

Ok well can you tell me why not having a toggle sunfire cape promotes smart playing? That's what I don't understand. Also, forgetting its a toggle ability is the players fault. Also, what downside are you trying to mention about not having toggle sunfire cape?

I already explained all three of those. Sunfire's passive has its counterplay, and can be used by both its owner and the opponent for an advantage. Yes, forgetting to toggle it would be the player's fault, but the point I made earlier is that it adds a layer of complexity that might not be necessary. 

Having a toggle promotes smart playing because it could be used in ways you wouldn't consider. For the owner, it forces them to consider their path through the jungle if they're trying to escape, as it aggros monsters. As someone who has used this before, you can see which camps are resetting and track someone's path like so if you don't have enough wards in your jungle or the opposing jungle. If someone has sunfire's cape and pushes you to tower, you can also enter melee range (if they're trying to avoid getting tower aggro) to immediately aggro them, beginning a trade that they will lose if they stay within your tower's range. 

It aids in pushing, but can also unwillingly push a wave if you stand too close to the minions. This can make it easier for an opponent to freeze a lane in their favor and force you to overextend, or zone you out from your minions when you back away as to not push out your minions too far. 

**Am I making sense here? This is just my opinion, like anyone else's. I'm not someone on the balancing team, so I don't have any data or research. I'm just a guy who thinks the item is just fine the way it is, that's all.**

I don't think I understood your third question perfectly, though, unless you're referring to 

>And the downsides give counterplay (tracking people with sunfire's isn't too hard in the jungle if you look for camps that are resetting), plus if someone is pushing your tower you can get tower aggro on them just by walking near them and taking a little bit of damage (like Irelia hitting Q on Shen, making her tower target him since she got touched by the passive).

The downsides is that sunfire's cape causes camps to aggro then reset, causes tower aggro if you're in melee range of a champion (someone, for instance, could use a gap closer like Irelia's Q to hit you for a trade, but you would lose it if you try to retaliate because of the tower already firing at you). It can be used by your opponents as a form of counterplay, rather than purely benefit you. It was just an interesting interaction I liked, and cared to mention. It's not a huge deal, if Riot chose to change it to a toggle, because sunfire's can be countered offensively with itemization, and defensively with simple magic resist.

Now, are we done? I neither want to piss anyone off or get pissed off for something as petty as a discussion over a single item of a video game, so please no hard feelings over this. If you got something to contribute on your side of the discussion, or just want to ask me something, go ahead. But at the very least respect my opinion.

And I will admit, toggling should at least be looked into, if not this item then for another. If Riot decides it not unneeded complexity, it *could* lead to some interesting mechanics. Reminds me of Ashe's frost shot, and I wonder if there could be an item that drains your mana while it's toggled for some passive or on-hit ability. I'm not completely opposed to the idea of toggled items, I'm hesitant, though certainly more curious after hearing others' opinions on the matter.

So what your telling me is that if its toggled it would deem to OP because you can control the enemy minions and can stop agro from camp monsters? So do you WANT a downside to Sunfire cape because of the counterplay you can use with the enemy burning your minions causing them to overextend?

 Well it does make sense, would you look at it the same way if toggling it doesn't mean using mana. I mean it makes sense if RIOT makes {{item:3068}} use mana, but do you hate toggle because it MIGHT require mana while toggled? Or if it doesn't need mana, would you like the idea of a toggled sunfire cape?
 
 What I think is that it should be toggled for more efficiancy in minion clearing or strategic plays by the freedom of toggling it on or off. I mean RIOT never puts any downsides to abilities, the only downside is that someone can counter that ability using plays and analyzing strengths and weakneeses you have in the game.

 What I mean is RIOT never puts abilities like TF2 Weapons, where its like lets say 50% more ammo, but 30% less damage. Usually RIOT would just tell us a tip about how to counter that ability or item using this and that. Like I dont know if Lee sin spams his q and keeps hitting you, gank him unexpectedly or play passivly until he overextends.

 Correct me if I am wrong, but what I think you are saying is that you want Sunfire Cape to have a weakness in itself by not toggling and having to take aggro from monsters as a price of it's fire AoE? I mean that's completly understandable, though I think  it's very odd for RIOT to be making TF2 like weapons. Where there is already a weakness and counterplay isn't a major thing to get rid of it. I think it's just the enemy team figuring a way out of how to counterplay the Sunfire cape. Toggle freedom just makes more plays and strategic setups for your team, and more efficiancy in my opinion.
The thing is, all those upsides are also downsides as well.  The person who's using the item should be able to choose whether or not they want those downsides along with the upsides.
no they should not. you cannot gain something without giving something up in return, otherwise it would be grossly unbalanced. you are not considering the opponents side of the equation here.

I am absolutely considering the opponents in the equation.  Turning off the aura gives both sides clear windows of opportunity based on choice and skill on both ends.  You can toggle off the aura to reduce aggro from things around you but you lose out on the damage, which lets the opponent move in and capitalize on that, since that's really the only thing keeping them from being able to trade at least equally anyway.

You still dont quite seem to grasp the entirety of what you are requesting with a toggle option. If you truly want to understand why sunfire cape is not a toggle item and what would have to be done to make it one, read this post in its entirety.

By including a toggle feature it would essentially allow you to obtain an additional ability to add to your kit simply by purchasing an item in game. One that would have 0 drawbacks whatsoever. there is no cost for activating it or deactivating it and no cost while it is on. Keep that in mind for my next examples.

Now let us look at champions that have the potential to have an always on damage aura in their basic kits. There are only 2, Amumu with Despair and Dr. Mundo with Burning Agony.

Despair costs Amumu mana to maintain. While it is possible to build certain items to allow him to keep despair on all the time, but it still **requires mana** to stay on. 

On the flip side you have Burning Agony which costs Dr. Mundo health to maintain. Again it is possible to build certain items so that he can keep it on without losing health, but it will still **require health** to stay on (even though it is technically possible to drain yourself to 1 health and still have it active... that would just be dumb of someone to do though).

Both champions have area of effect damage abilities they can toggle but both have a cost to use. So why should Sunfire cape get the ability to toggle with no cost at all to the user, just because you had to buy it? sorry not enough.

If you still dont seem to understand and want to be able to toggle sunfire cape then lets propose a cost to having it active since you seem to want to have an additional ability on your kit. Mana and any other resource is out of the question since not every champion has a resource, what does that leave? health. Alright then, You want to be able to toggle sunfire cape, Okay it will just deal 50% of its aura damage to you while it is active. Sound like an item you want to buy now? You get the optimal playstyle you so desperately and lazily want, right?

As for your considering both sides of the equation... are you kidding me? the fact it deals damage all the time IS an upside for opponents WHEN someone with sunfire cape is attacking a tower. all you have to do is walk up to them, take a single second of damage and boom, instant turret aggro.

If sunfire could be toggled off it becomes a DOWNSIDE to opponents because the player with sunfire could build a double wave of minions and go to a turret and start attacking it. It now requires that one of the opposing teams key damage dealers to come and stop them from you taking their tower. Why? because sunfire cape is a tank item, it gives you a bunch of health and a bunch of armor which means sending a low damage support with poor clear or another tank with slow clear is pointless because the person with sunfire is just going to sit and attack the tower till either he is low health and has to fall back or takes the tower and falls back because, remember, he has a double wave of minions or maybe more worth of time to hit the tower without having to draw aggro from it.

Now you are going to try and convince yourself, well that seems fair... Again not looking at the big picture. You are a tank that happens to have teleport, built a sunfire cape, and created a large minion wave so you can split push one of your opponents towers with the extra time the wave gives you. The opposing team now has to send the ADC, mid laner, jungler, or whoever can actually deal enough damage to beat you off of their turret before it falls. That leaves them at a disadvantage in numbers while the rest of your team split push another lane knowing a good damage dealer has to go to the other towers aid. That damage dealer shows up to defend the tower, you fall back and teleport to the rest of your team to dive the other team and get 2 turrets because of the FORCED disadvantage they are in.

Now you are going to say "but this already happens with sunfire cape now"... you are right. You dont seem to see the difference though. since sunfire cape cant be "toggled" off it only takes one opponent of whatever strength to go to the towers rescue since they need only get close to you the aggressor in order for the turret to aggro onto you. "but then you just do the same thing and teleport to your other teammates dive and blah blah blah." The difference this time is the opposing team sent the weakest link on their team to keep you from taking the turret leaving all the damage and danger to defend against the rest of your team. Which leaves them a better chance of turning a dive in their favor.

I know I am being condescending, and to a certain extent that is on purpose. I do know and understand why you would like to have the ability to toggle sunfrie cape. It would be nice to get all of its benefits with none of its drawbacks. Those drawbacks **have** to be there though in order to maintain balance in the game. They keep it so that one item/champion does not become a must build/pick or ban in order to win the game for your team.

Except you STILL have yet to read my and others' proposals to fix the "zero-drawback" problem for it.  Stop posting walls of text that make you seem like you know what you're doing just to say the same thing over and over.

This is probably the best reasoning that I have seen for this question that gets brought up about once a month on here. I normally just say yeah why not make it a toggle? Whats it going to hurt? I never really thought of all the reasons why it would hurt. 

1 UP
I am glad you found it useful. thanks for the compliment :)

Aside from the fact that Sunfire Cape has been requested to be a toggle since 2011, and I don't think they are going to do it now, you are leaving out a lot of the counterplay.

Dedicated top laners know that when the enemy gets a sunfire cape, that is the best time to let them push despite having no jungler presence. In place of AoE damage, you need to sacrifice the fact that you will push the lane, you are not entitled to AoE damage whenever it is convenient for you (Singed/Mundo/Swain), and Riot has acknowledged that.

The major counterplay is pushing a turret. The enemy can prevent you from attacking turrets by simply standing next to you. That is very intelligent counterplay. Otherwise you're a fast lane pusher with no drawbacks.

The drawback of {{item:3003}}  is that you need to spam abilities to build up your tear. Many champions cannot do this for a long time.

{{item:3085}}  has a similar drawback if the enemy is standing right next to the turret. That is also not a toggle despite the drawback of always pushing and hitting champions when it's not wanted.
And smart playing isn't not forgetting to keep it toggled on/off?

Maybe, but not quite what I meant. The passive can screw you over (showing which way you went in the jungle, for instance, if you're running and the enemy saw which camp just reset) or taking aggro from dragon or Baron at the worst times. But what it gives is nice, though. 

As for remembering to toggle it on and off, you already have four spells and other actives on your inventory to keep track of. Toggle items would just add a level of complexity of micromanagement, I think items with actives are good enough as is. Leave toggling to the spells, I say. :/
I've had games with 6 active items in my inventory before.  Having a toggled sunfire instead of a randuins isn't much different.  Easier, IMO.

I dunno, Randuins still had a cooldown so you're not going to be constantly switching it on and off.

It's not a bad idea, but it wouldn't be terrible to keep it as is. *adjusts hipster glasses*

I had 6 actives as Lulu on URF.

_Drops mic_

I can see where you're coming from, but that's not really relevant.

Still, that is impressive. O_O

It is relevant because someone buying an item with an active opts into the responsibility of knowing when to use the active and remembering to do so. If you're afraid you'll forget and lose out on your damage, just don't toggle it off. For those of us that want the aura when we want it but don't want to be punished by not being able to get close to a tower with an enemy nearby or not being able to walk through the jungle with Mobility Boots, it's a good option to have.

>For those of us that want the aura when we want it but don't want to be punished by not being able to get close to a tower with an enemy nearby or not being able to walk through the jungle with Mobility Boots, 

*shrugs*

It's part of the counterplay, or at least in my opinion. Keep on advocating for a change, I've already (tried to) make my peace and stop arguing. I have my opinion, you've got yours, why not try to ask Riot for their opinion? If they got some info on it, it'd certainly be interesting. Mine doesn't really matter in the long run, and I'd experiment with an item toggle if it happened instead of putting on my hipster glasses and complaining about it.

So yeah, keep on lobbying for it and see what happens. If this is what the community wants, let's hear what Riot's got to say.

they already answered this question a long while ago, if memory serves it was at the start of or during season 3 when its health was reduced and a bunch of changes were going on with giants belt at the time as well. they tried the toggle option and didn't like what they had to do in order to keep it balanced.

> Toggle items would just add a level of complexity of micromanagement

You are free to leave it permanently on if toggling an item is too difficult for you.

Okay, you could have easily worded that to not insult me just for stating an opinion.

Obviously it's not difficult, it's just another layer of micromanagement.

Oh man, it'd be so helpful to hide myself when I'm playing Sunfire Cape Teemo. When they run over me when Im hiding and they know they take damage, I'm immediately seen. +1 for the great sunfire Teemo.
Really, what is this thread?
Really though, who gets Sunfire Cape on Teemo.   xD
Sunfire provides tankiness, and very strong dueling power. Those 2 things should never be on an item at the same time without having some downside.

There's lots of ways for enemies to manipulate those downsides, is the problem.  There's only one way for the person using the cape to utilize the upside - stand right next to someone and hope they burn to death.

> [{quoted}](name=Mmm Broccoli,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WaUiZMzr,comment-id=00110000,timestamp=2015-04-13T05:18:30.617+0000)
>
> There's lots of ways for enemies to manipulate those downsides, is the problem.  There's only one way for the person using the cape to utilize the upside - stand right next to someone and hope they burn to death.

Except pushing is both an upset and downside.

Someone like Shen fucking loves the constant AoE damage from Sunfire.

Sunfire makes it so you have to seriously consider going to get a CS (against someone with Sunfire) because you are straight up going to take 120 damage for taking just ONE CS if the enemy is competent.

So yes, that is a lot of power to be had on one item.

Because the cons of the lack-of-toggle are calculated. You push your lane harder whether you want to or not and, as has been said, makes tower diving more difficult. Add in a toggle and you will directly buff the item by eliminating these cons, and as such the item will probably have to be nerfed to make room. If you recognize it as a buff and are willing to let the numbers be brought down then by all means keep going, I personally disagree though.

As I've said before, a suitable nerf would be to make it so that every time you toggle it off, the damage has to ramp back up after a few seconds to get back to full potential.  A flat nerf could work as well, but I feel like they could actually increase the radius or something if they nerf the damage up front.

...Or you could just give it a few second cooldown.  Or both.  That's not up for me to really decide, haha.  I'm just theorycrafting at this point.

What about possibly having half of the armor removed when it's toggled off as well? Or even all of it.  The health could be constant, but remove some/all of the armor if the Aura is off.  Turning it off to not push would then open up chances for your opponent to do a little extra damage, in exchange for you not pushing/getting instant tower agro.

All of it would be a bit harsh, but a fun way to do it would be to make it so that during the cooldown of the toggle the bonus armor gets removed and slowly ramps up (instead of the sunfire damage).

So, for example, it gives 30 armor but when you toggle it off it gives 0, then 5, then 10, then 15, etc. til back to 30 again and the aura would be back up.
Then no one would turn it off because their lane opponent would capitalize the hell out of that, and then we're back to square 1.
The point is that you can't buy an extremely powerful dueling item for lane without giving your opponent a way to safely farm.
I don't see how this removes their ability to farm.  It takes the damage away.  The moment someone toggles off the Sunfire Cape, it allows you to get within melee range and punish them.
